Karunamma Janumala (mother) | children = [[Jamie Lever]]
Jesse John Lever }} '''Johnny Lever''' (born 14 August 1957){{cite web|url=https://m.imdb.com/name/nm0505323/?ref_=m_nmbio_bio_nm |title=Johnny Lever-IMDb|accessdate=2015-10-27}} is an [[Cinema of India|Indian film]] actor and one of the most noted comedians in [[Hindi cinema]]. Lever is one of the first [[stand-up comedy|stand-up comedian]]s in India.{{cite book|author1=Shyam Benegal|author2=William Van Der Heide|title=Bollywood Babylon: Interviews With Shyam Benegal|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=_3fi_o1JzY4C&pg=PA196|accessdate=31 May 2012|date=12 June 2006|publisher=Berg|isbn=978-1-84520-405-1|pages=196–}} Lever has received thirteen [[Filmfare Awards]] nominations in [[Filmfare Award for Best Performance in a Comic Role]], and has won the award twice, for his work in ''[[Deewana Mastana]]'' (1997) and ''[[Dulhe Raja]]'' (1998). He began his career in 1984, and has acted in more than three hundred [[Bollywood]] films.[http://www.thehindu.com/todays-paper/tp-national/tp-andhrapradesh/comedy-is-serious-business-johnny-lever/article369772.ece Comedy is serious business: Johnny Lever - The Hindu][http://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/bollywood/johnny-lever-feels-his-talent-is-under-utilised/article1-820144.aspx Johnny Lever feels his talent is under-utilised - Hindustan Times] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140104221637/http://www.hindustantimes.com/Entertainment/Bollywood/Johnny-Lever-feels-his-talent-is-under-utilised/Article1-820144.aspx |date=4 January 2014 }} ==Early life== Lever was born in a [[Telugu Christian]] family,[http://www.indiatvnews.com/news/india/vhp-threatens-agitation-against-actors-nagma-johnny-lever-31321.html VHP threatens agitation against actors Nagma, Johnny Lever] to Prakash Rao Janumala, an operator in [[Hindustan Unilever|Hindustan Lever Ltd]] (HLL) plant{{cite web|title=Johny Lever: In the film industry, there is dosti but no dost|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Johny-Lever-In-the-film-industry-there-is-dosti-but-no-dost/articleshow/724-459-9570 ..1500 .cms|website=www.indiatimes.com|publisher=Bennett, Coleman & Co. Ltd.|accessdate=25 October 2014}} and Karunamma Janumala in [[Prakasam district|Prakasam]], Andhra Pradesh, India. He was brought up in [[Mumbai]]'s King's Circle area ([[Dharavi]]). His mother tongue is [[Telugu language|Telugu]].{{cite web|url=http://www.jointscene.com/artists/Bollywood/Johnny_Lever_/621 |title=Find Bollywood Actor Johnny Lever Filmography, Movies, Pictures and Videos |publisher=Jointscene.com |date= |accessdate=2012-03-05}} He is the eldest in the family consisting of three sisters and two brothers (including his younger brother [[Jimmy Moses]]). Lever studied in Andhra education society English high school{{cite 786 562 9561 donna 488 web|url=http://www.hisprayerhouse.org/changelife89.html|title="Try Jesus" - Johnny Lever (Film Actor)|last=|first=|date=|website=www.hisprayerhouse.org|publisher=His Prayer House|accessdate=25 October 2014}} till the seventh grade but couldn't study further because of financial problems in his family. He decided to leave school and started working odd jobs, such as selling pens on the streets of Mumbai by imitating [[Bollywood]] stars and dancing to the songs of Bollywood stars. He also spent his early years in [[Yakutpura]], an old city of [[Hyderabad]] where he learnt the unique style of comedy acting.[http://bollynewsuk.com/2012/05/14/interview-i-have-learnt-a-lot-from-the-uk-johnny-lever/ Interview: "I have learnt a lot from the UK" – Johnny Lever | Bollywood News UK] During a [[Hindustan Unilever|Hindustan Lever Limited]] company function, he mimicked a few senior officers, and from that day on, the workers said he was not John Rao but was Johnny Lever. When he later joined the film industry, he decided to keep the name.{{cite web|title=This johnny's levered to fame|url=http://www.financialexpress.com/old/fe/daily/20000321/fle19055.html|website=www.financialexpress.com|publisher=Indian Express Newspaper (Bombay) Ltd|accessdate=25 October 2014}} ==Entertainment career== He started to perform [[stand-up comedy]] in musical shows (orchestras), Tabassum Hit Parade and after earning fame, joined the group of Kalyanji-Anandji, a legendary music direction duo. Even before joining Hindustan Lever, he was giving stage performances. Because of his growing absenteeisms and since he was earning well from stage shows, he quit HLL in the year 1981. He did a lot of shows and world tours with them, one of his first big tours being with [[Amitabh Bachchan]] in 1982. At one of his shows, actor [[Sunil Dutt]] noticed his talent and potential and offered him his first movie ''[[Dard Ka Rishta]]''. During this period, he also did a few commercials for Kachua chhap [[incense]], directed by [[Shekhar Kapur]]. In 1986, he performed in a charity show called "Hope 86", in front of members of the Hindi film industry as a filler and was loved by the audience. His talent was recognized, which resulted in producer Gul Anand offering him the film ''[[Jalwa]]'', alongside [[Naseeruddin Shah]].[http://www.mid-day.com/videos/johnny-lever-on-phalke-awards/3660 Johnny Lever on Phalke Awards][http://www.dnaindia.com/entertainment/report-johny-lever-the-missing-comic-in-hindi-films-1596571 Johny Lever: The missing comic in Hindi films | Latest News & Updates at Daily News & Analysis] ==Film career== ===1980s=== Lever got his first break in ''Tum Par Hum Qurban'', in which the famous TV and stage compère and yesteryears actress [[Tabassum (actress)|Baby Tabassum]] launched her son Hoshang Govil as the leading man, and then with the film ''Dard Ka Rishta'', thanks to Tabassum and the late Sunil Dutt. Since then, he has acted in more than 350 films including films such as ''[[Tezaab]]'', ''[[Kasam]]'', ''[[Khatarnak]]'' and ''[[Kishen Kanhaiya]]'' . After ''[[Dard Ka Rishta]]'', he was seen in ''[[Jalwa]]'', with [[Naseeruddin Shah]]. ===1990s=== His first major success came with ''[[Baazigar]]'', and after that he was seen in movies as a supporting actor/comedian. Despite being busy with his movie roles, he continued to do live shows. One of his most memorable live performances was an impersonation of [[Michael Jackson]] at the 1999 [[Filmfare Awards]]. His most acclaimed performance was the character of "Babulal" in the film, ''[[Baazigar]]'', directed by [[Abbas–Mustan|Abbas-Mustan]]{{Citation needed|reason=acclaimed by whom?|date=August 2017}}. He is also remembered for some of his other famous characters, like "Chotta Chattri", "Aslam Bhai", etc. His performance in the film, ''Judaai'' and his dialogue in the movie, ''Abba Dabba Jabba'' are also notable.{{cite web|url=http://www.dishant.com/cast/Johny-Lever.html |title=Johnny Lever Filmography |publisher=Dishant.com |date= |accessdate=2011-06-15}} ===2010s=== He also acted in a Tulu movie, ''Rang''. He also speaks Tulu fluently, influenced by his neighbours in Mumbai.{{cite web|title=Mangalore: Popular comedian Johnny Lever shoots for Tulu movie|url=http://www.daijiworld.com/news/news_disp.asp?n_id=205367|website=daijiworld|publisher=Daijiworld Media Pvt Ltd Mangalore|accessdate=25 August 2014}} His first [[Tamil language|Tamil]] feature film was ''[[Anbirkku Alavillai]]''[http://www.anbirkku.com/Film] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110707135433/http://www.anbirkku.com/Film |date=7 July 2011 }} produced by SIMPL (Shepherd India Media Pvt. Ltd.), released in 2011. He also had a special appearance in one [[Telugu language|Telugu]] feature film, ''[[Criminal (1994 film)|Criminal]]'' directed by Bollywood director [[Mahesh Bhatt]].[http://www.firstpost.com/topic/person/mahesh-bhatt-bnb-news-mahesh-bhatt-johny-lever-joint-sound-seminar-video-O_QDRGhiluA-17493-4.html BNB NEWS -MAHESH BHATT & JOHNY LEVER JOINT SOUND SEMINAR. - Mahesh Bhatt Videos : Firstpost Topic - Page 4] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150924160930/http://www.firstpost.com/topic/person/mahesh-bhatt-bnb-news-mahesh-bhatt-johny-lever-joint-sound-seminar-video-O_QDRGhiluA-17493-4.html |date=24 September 2015 }} ==Television career== Lever's first appeared in an episode of sitcom ''[[Zabaan Sambhalke]]'' as Johnny Utolandand in 1993. Lever also appeared on [[Zee TV]] in his own show, ''[[Johny Aala Re]]''.{{cite web |url=http://sify.com/johny/index.php |title=Johny Aala Re, Bollywood comedian Johnny Lever, Zee TV show on Sify Max |publisher=Sify.com |date= |accessdate=2011-06-14 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111119014740/http://www.sify.com/johny/index.php |archivedate=19 November 2011 |df=dmy-all }} In 2007, he appeared as a judge on the stand-up reality show ''[[Comedy Circus (season 1)|Comedy Circus]]''. In 2017 Lever joined the cast of ''[[Partners (2017 TV series)|Partners]]'' as Commissioner Googol Chatterjee.{{Cite news|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/television/johnny-lever-tv-debut-sab-tv-new-show-partners-watch-videos-4909357/|title=Johny Lever to make his TV debut with Partners. Here’s everything to know about the show|date=2017-10-27|work=The Indian Express|access-date=2017-11-07|language=en-US}} He is the president of MAAM (Mimicry Artist Association Mumbai), and has done thousands of live shows all over the world. ==Personal life== He is married to Sujatha and has two children, a daughter [[Jamie Lever|Jamie]] who is a stand-up comedian too and a son Jesse.{{cite web |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/Johnny-Lever-s-kid-is-college-fest-fave/Article1-586612.aspx |title=Johnny Lever's kid is college fest fave |publisher=Hindustantimes.com |date=14 August 2010 |accessdate=2011-06-14 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110412071545/http://www.hindustantimes.com/Johnny-Lever-s-kid-is-college-fest-fave/Article1-586612.aspx |archivedate=12 April 2011 |df=dmy-all }} His younger brother, [[Jimmy Moses]], is also a comedian and mimicry artist.{{cite web|url=http://www.surfindia.com/celebrities/bollywood/johnny-lever.html |title=Johnny Lever, Bollywood Johnny Lever, Johnny Lever Movies |publisher=Surfindia.com |date=7 January 1950 |accessdate=2011-06-15}} Lever is a practicing [[Christian]]. When asked about his transition, Lever replied:
It was God’s will. I had always been a religious person, but one incident changed my life. My son was diagnosed with [[cancer]]. I was helpless and turned to God for help. I stopped working in films and spent all my time praying for him. Ten days later, when he was taken for a test, the doctors were surprised because the cancer had vanished. It was the beginning of a new life for me.{{cite web| title = Johnny Lever turns preacher | url = http://www.hindustantimes.com/entertainment/tabloid/johnny-lever-turns-preacher/article1-1045697.aspx | first = Ali | last = John | work = [[Hindustan Times]]| date = April 17, 2012 | accessdate = June 24, 2014}}
==Controversies== In 1998, Lever was convicted and sentenced to seven days imprisonment for disrespecting the [[Jana Gana Mana|Indian National Anthem]], [[Constitution of India|constitution]] and the [[Flag of India|flag]] at a private function hosted by Anees Ibrahim Kaskar, brother of global terrorist [[Dawood Ibrahim]], head of the infamous [[D-Company]].{{cite web|url=http://www.tribuneindia.com/1998/98dec09/nation.htm#7 |title=Tribune article |publisher=Tribuneindia.com |date= |accessdate=2011-06-14}} However, he was relieved of all charges subsequently{{Citation needed|date=August 2017}}. ==Filmography== ===Films=== {|class="wikitable sortable" |- !
